intro: Leucopogon oblongifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved heath, is a flowering plant native to the eastern regions of Australia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils, often in heathlands or coastal areas, and is adapted to nutrient-poor environments. Its narrow, lance-shaped leaves are usually covered in a fine layer of white wax, which helps reduce water loss in its often arid habitat.
